H0.text: Waxing gibbous is the moon phase that occurs approximately 14 days after a full moon.

H1.text: Waning crescent is the moon phase that occurs approximately 14 days after a full moon.

H2.text: First quarter is the moon phase that occurs approximately 14 days after a full moon.

H3.text: The new moon is the moon phase that occurs approximately 14 days after a full moon.

A4.text: The duration from full moon to new moon varies from approximately 13 days 22+1⁄2 hours to about 15 days 14+1⁄2 hours.

A5.text: The intermediate phases (waning gibbous, waning crescent) last approximately 7.38 days each.
